Despite having no head, she does manage to have a personality and can be very expressive. Through her body language and her way of communicating. Through texting what she says through an iTouch looking phone. That and her backstory on how she lost her head is actually pretty tragic, which makes you route for the character. She does get assistance from a scientist named Shinra Kishitani. Whose relationship with Celty can take many twists and turns along the way.


This is a pretty entertaining cast, but it's not as memorable as the one in Baccano! Which gave equal amount of screen time for each character.


The Music (7/10)


In tradition, the music revolves around jazzy and blues like music that can be catchy when it wants to be. Not only that, but both opening themes do follow the same format as Baccano's. While the music, it shows every single character and places them in still frames, giving the characters name. The first opening theme "Trust Me" is a very catchy song that's very reminiscent of several pop songs from the early 2000's. The visuals are so fun to watch, that you'll find yourself re-watching the end credits. As it features all the characters in some form of tower, where each one carries the other in a funny looking way. The second ending theme "Butterfly" really suites the more darker tone of the second half. Which it's visuals have a similar format as Trust Me's, but not as entertaining.


Overall (7/10)


Durarara!! may be the best anime with the stupidest title. Even if it's not on par with it's sister series, it still manages to be fun to watch in it's own right. With it's intriguing ideas, fun characters, and dark atmosphere. I high recommend it to those who really enjoyed Baccano! Just don't expect it to be as good.

This is my first review on this site,and I only recently joined,so go easy on me ok? xD
First,let me say,i will be very biased in this review as I love this show.
Second,this review will be short and to the point.
Wow,what to say about this show that hasn't already been said? 
To summarise it,this is a show that tries everything and anything,and manages to pull it off in a unique and enjoyable way.
The story,even though it suffers from a slow start and some pacing problems,is pretty solid and keeps you gripped from start to finish.
The cast is great,from the "headless rider",to Shizou and his superhuman rage.TheMusic is excellent:It has a wide range of tracks,from Irish to Jazz.I also enjoyed both op's and both ed's\n
The animation was great at the start,although it wasn't perfect.Its isn't aiming to be the best looking anime in existence,and it doesn't have to.Overall,the art is consistent and fits the mood of the show.\n\n
I really enjoyed durarararararararararara,despite a few flaws here and there.It is an excellent and gripping show,that I highly recommend.Thumbs up for Brains base.

People trying out this anime would, after the first few episodes, shelve this in the very exclusive "WTF?" category. At first glance, there's a very inconsistent plotline, and the characters are  easy to segregate - some are fairly generic, and  some are frackin' crazy. A whole lot of mess happens in Ikebukuro - there's color gangs, vending machines and trash bins flipping through the air, a supposedly headless biker? Wow. But this anime is hard to give up. It'is just strange and offbeat and hard to ignore. As the anime progresses, the different stories it's collected thus far comes together, giving us apanoramic view to the DRRR!! universe.


Admittedly, the animation is nothing to 'wow' over, but I still think it's quite admirable. The style is clean, and gives a realistic take on a surreal plot. I also find the soundtrack pleasing to listen. Certain songs touches upon different genres and instruments, giving it a versatile feel. The songs go well with these bizarre situations.


Looking at some of the previous reviews made about Durarara!! here, I find it hard to believe that people would think, from just the first few episodes, that everyone in the cast is interesting and when it comes to character development, DRRR!! trumps all. Not necessarily true. 

Sure, some of the characters you see from the start spark a bit of interest - the mysterious Celty, the apathetic Izaya, and the rage-induced Shizuo. And they - as well as many others - gain more depth and complexity as we follow them throughout the show. But some are rather flat and remain so, such as the trio that the show tends to revolve around - Mikado, Kida, and Anri. Despite what characters you may/may not prefer, they all connect with one another, and the viewer gains an equal perspective with every one of them. In a way, Durarara!! samples a window of what life purely is.

Well, Yeah! I gave it a 10/10 I wouldn't say it was completely rational for me to give it a 10, but the entertainment level , the characters and just how they put everything together is just completely amazing! Like Hisashi Sasaki , the editor in Bakuman, said "as long as the Manga is interesting, people will like it!" I think this statement is the same for anime.
Story: 8/10 
Imagine this: You are nearsighted and you don't have glasses or contacts. You never knew if you are going to get one at all so you start looking at people really closely in order to seetheir details. But one day, someone forcefully puts a pair of glasses on you and now, you not only see the people you want to see, you also remember every detail about them! This is basically how the story of this anime is set up.


The story of this anime is narrated by different characters throughout the story and most of the the first half of the anime is about introducing the main characters through some events they go though and most of these episodes are narrated by the characters themselves. To be honest, even though it took them about 12 episodes to introduce most of the important characters, it is not the most easy-to-understand character introduction and I am sure that is also what makes this anime so interesting. After the first half(not exactly first 12ep. but around there) Hell breaks loose and everything starts to come together. That is all I'm going to say because saying anything becomes a spoiler. 


PS: If you like to guess what happens next you will either have no clue about what is happening at all to the extent that you cannot even make a single guess or, if they want you to know, you will get exactly everything right. 


Art: 9/10 


There is seriously nothing too great about the art itself, but this art style is perfect for Durarara! If someone looks weird, he is supposed to and vise versa. 

The atmospheric feeling of the art is often in somebody's perspective, often expressing what the person is observing at or tries to know about.


Sound: 9.5/10 


The music of the OP and ED is great and what makes it better is the opening animation! The opening also contains a review of some information that is essential to the current episode. I watched and listened to every single OP without skipping a second! It is THAT exciting ^_^


The sound tracks of Durarara! is an amazing mood creator, sometimes it is really subtle and sometimes it is really strong, but I never found it annoying.



Character 10/10


First, I would Like you to decide for yourself what makes a character interesting. Maybe it's their past experiences and the things that they've gone through. Perhaps it is their personality.


There are TONS of main characters in this anime including three high school students, an information seller, an abnormal doctor with a headless rider and a guy who is always in a bartender suit. Connect them, I dare you. One of the most amazing thing about these characters is that they are all connect in some way and through some events but they are not always connected but almost every single one of them effect each other greatly. 


At this point, many would ask about the character development. Well, many of them do change and "grow up" through major events but in many cases their personality and their past itself is already interesting enough that I don't think it can get much more interesting. The most interesting characters may not always be the dynamic ones!


No matter what type of character you are looking for, Cool, Badass, Ambitious and about everything else you would think of. This series truly contains so many interesting characters that I guarantee you will at least find a few, both main and supporting, characters really interesting.


Entertainment 10/10


For me, this is definitely the most important aspect of an anime. The entertainment section is basically the byproduct of every other aspect of an anime working together and the resonance of the story, characters, sound art, of Durarara! is just so great that every moment is fun. 

Generally, this is neither the anime that makes the audience laugh out loud nor cry. Instead, it is able to bring the smile out of an audience while making him constantly think.

I know many people, including me, likes to watch anime/films with a critical mind, but C'mon, I am positive that 99% of you are watching anime for entertainment, so let us try to not let that aspect carry us away. If you are seriously someone who just watches an anime to find out good and bad aspects of the anime, Durarara! will not disappoint you either. And maybe you can tell me the reasons behind Durarara! being so F**king Cool and interesting!


In general, I would recommend this anime to everyone in both sexes since it is just so unique in style. Trust me, this anime will not disappoint you and watching it will be a fantastic experience！

When I watch a show or play a game, I typically value the characters and the world heavily: All of my favorites excel in either one of these aspects. When I find a show tha excels at both of these aspects, it's pretty much a dead ringer for one of my favorite shows. Today in anticipation for the Season 2, we have a show that pulls this off and because of it, is in my Top 10 anime: Durarara!!
Story + Characters
Durarara!! has a story that tries to do everything, and manages to do everything. Written by Ryohgo Narita (who also did Baccano), it’s a storythat matches expectations you may have and does a bit more: It’s an ensemble cast character drama with romance, pure comedy, supernatural aspects, gang wars, and anything else you can really imagine. The best part? Every one of these aspects is executed pretty well (in my opinion), creating a highly enjoyable show that never gets old no matter how often you watch it. That being said, it's not so much something that's made to blow your mind in how awesome it is, but it's a show that's just so enjoyable and fun that I can't help but love it. It's rare to see a show that focuses on being very entertaining while keeping the quality in other aspects high enough that you truly find an enjoyable show. It's really a recipe of success, and I love it when I find shows like this. (Others that come to mind that is like this is FMA:B, Date A Live, Soul Eater, etc.)


Durarara!! takes place in Tokyo's downtown district of Ikebukuro, an interesting yet dangerous town where many unusual things happen… you could almost say it’s magical. With cursed blades, headless dulahans, gang wars and people with superhuman strength, it’s a hectic story the story that manages to capture the feeling of the city, which is really what the story is about. What makes the city special though is that feels alive, sprawling, and ever-changing: it feels like a character with it's mind of it's own, a character that changes and develops the whole way through. It's more than just a setting: DRRR!! is the story of this living, changing city and all the absurdity that comes with this which makes it that much more enjoyable.. and I wouldn't have it any other way. The show lets you get to know it's version of Ikebukuro, from the gossip to the gangs and folklore, and it makes you feel like you are truly living in this hectic city. It feels very modern, fast paced and crazy, like a real city should. When Mikado feels nervous because he's in a new town, you feel that too. When people start talking about rumors  It's an amazing atmosphere that is directly attached to the story thus also to the characters and the viewer, and it's something I love.


Speaking of the characters, DRRR!! has an ensemble cast that is absolutely fantastic, one of the few ensemble casts I actually like: every character is interesting, likable, memorable, unique and fleshed out. The characters are truly the core structure for the story, the fallback when other aspects grow weak or what motivates you to keep watching, it's what the show relies on and it's by far the best aspect of the show. While it's probably the largest ensamble cast I've seen in anime, they manage to make such a large cast feel small because it's done so well that they are all well rounded and enjoyable. The characters get solid development as they have interesting issues that they have to deal with, and the way they struggle through it is admirable, even if not relatable. I could talk to you about how great each of the characters are, but i'd be here for hours just babbling on how mikado is a perfect main character who is very easy to relate to or how awesome celty is as a character and a legend.... yeah... they're great, some of my favorites.


The whole is greater than the parts though, and it's the interactions they have that is the icing on the cake. The interactions they have with each other is spot on just seeing what they do is very entertaining, and it makes the cast that much better... it's rare that I see a cast that I like as much as DRRR!!. They have an interesting dynamic in the way that they deal with and seeing this dynamic is engaging and interesting. The way DRRR!! balances the motivations and goals between the characters, entwining their thoughts and fate is great, and I loved every bit of it.


Speaking of the way that DRRR handles the story, the execution is pretty solid. The way they transition between the is pretty great, going through and utilizing the ensamble cast by changing perspectives is something I appreciate. The story isn't exactly a linear story, more like a slog through an onburst of information and rumors, going through what is running through the rumor mill. It's not the neatest plot, but it's a story I aprpeciate because it adds charm and realism, while making it feel episodic at times,a feeling I miss when watching shows as of late. The pacing is pretty solid as well, preventing the show from having a dull moment: it's frenetic at times, lethargic at times, but always natural and entertaining... in a way it's simulating how life is, which is really fitting for the show. I also really appreciate the integration of random aspects of the world like the chatroom and off comment remarks, it's something that adds charm and is a reason why I love DRRR so much.  Durarara is like a window into another world in our modern world (more specifically it's version of Ikebukoro) and it's extremely interesting.


That being said, the writing isn't perfect, and there's a lot of people who just don't care too much for Durarara!! because of it. Personally, I never found any issues with the writing that have bothered me while watching the show, but those who have generally have valid complaints and I would be showing a little bit too much of my bias if I didn't take a look at them and consider them.


1) The story isn't really all that clear and can be confusing at times: Yes, plot points do not connect, the writing isn't there to blow your mind, it does have writing issues and it's not really presented in a way that's super clear, but nitpicking that in my opinion goes against the whole meaning of the show. Durarara!! goes with the flow to simulate life a bit in that aspect because it's story of life in a city, but along with that is the hectic confusion that comes with living in a city. considering that this is a show about the lives of people in a city... it isn't supposed to be cleancut. Real lives aren't always tied up in a neat bow.


2) The show focuses too much on the 3 high schoolers (Mikado, Kida and Anri) and at the end of the show, and this is boring to watch, it turns into a "soap opera": I saw this complaint several times, but I didn't see it when I watch the show. I really liked because of the personalities they have, the dynamics between their relationship, and the groups they represent.  They may be not as great as others in the cast, but I don't think that's saying bad about them as it's saying how great the rest of of the cast is as in my opinion, these three are well developed and interesting. While they may not be as interesting as other characters in the show, I don't think boring is the right word to describe it. 


Overall, Durarara!! is written in a way that's fun. It may not be the most gripping or amazing narratives, but it's done in a way that will absorb you in and engage you with the events happening in the show.


Visuals

While Durarara!! doesn't aim to be the best looking anime, that doesn't necessarily mean it looks bad... in fact, if you ask me, it looks pretty decent. Durarara!! has a great stylized design that really adds to the show: it's modern, it makes things pop, it's very clean in design, and it looks solid, but the animation itself could use a bit of polish. (But honestly, if this bothers you guys, you haven't seen anything ._.) It does the job: it's clean, looks solid in general and tries it's best to not get in the way. Due to the execution, the visuals usually serve to support other aspects of the story moreso than looking nice (It can look pretty great as it sometimes picks up during action scene). It's filled with minor niceties that add flair to the show and make it stand out like the fact that non important people aren't colored (lol), the colored highlights used in the show to make things stand out , the atmospheric tones, and because of these, it can stand out from the rest of the show. Overall though,  it generally keeps a consistent level of quality and that's what matters. 


Sound

If there's one aspect of this show that is universally praised, it's the soundtrack. It's a great soundtrack that is pleasing to the ear, absolutely makes the mood, and has a great personality. It's thrilling, engaging, interesting, unique, awesome, and any other adjectives I can throw at it. Really, it speaks for itself. I just love how it fits with the situation extremely well, as it's modern and there's a huge variety that I appreciate, with a great use of distinct instruments and jazz. Absolutely one of my favorite soundtracks.


Onto the voice acting... I'm pretty sure that Durarara!! has the best voice acting I've seen in the past few years... both dubbed and subbed. I've originally got into durarara via dub and I prefer that one, but both have A+ talant (Miyano Mamoru, Kana Hanazawa, Miyuki Sawashiro, Jun Fukuyama are some greats for the Japanese, and Crispin Freeman, Johnny Yong Bosh, Steve Blum are some greats for the English) and everyone did a fantastic job. It's a treat for the ears, and it's a joy to listen to. 

10


Enjoyment


Take everything I said about it, and it's pretty easy to see what this section is going to be like. I love Durarara!! to no end, it’s one of my favorites, it’s one of the few shows that I rewatch every year, and it's one of the few shows that I can enjoy every time. Durarara!! Is a show that’s geared for your enjoyment, and it satisfies this exceedingly well. It’s an experience that’s loads of fun, a show that is a blast every time I see it. All of the aspects build up to create an experience that feels alive, fells magical and it's something I appreciate. I get completely absorbed when watching it and i'm consistently entertained throughout. The little things that this show does do so much to help my experience with this and I can't help but love it. It's a show with a personality and this personality is something I fell in love with.

10


Conclusion 

Durarara!! is a show that I love to no end. It may have it's flaws, but really in the face of how entertaining it is, I don't find that to be much of an issue, and you shouldn't either. I'm looking to the continuation of one of my favorite shows, and hopefully I'll love it as much as this season.


Overall 9/10 Polarization +1, -3

Durarara is one of my favorite animes, it was very interesting and kept you going, but the first few episodes are somewhat slow. It speeds up as you keep watching. The anime is about a boy named Mikado Ryuugamine is a high school student who moves to Ikebukuro to attend school with his childhood friend, Kida Masaomi. When Mikado does get there, Kida warns him about the dangers of Ikebukuro, such as an information broker, a headless rider, a man with superhuman strength, and a gang slowly gaining power called the Dollars. The story line may seem dull to people, but it is very interestingand there are plot twists everywhere. It's very suspenseful and catches you off guard. The characters are unique and the anime was very entertaining. The songs may be weird at first, but they turn out to be very catchy and may even get stuck in your head.

This is a show that has one of the most engrossing settings with many amazing characters to fill it. This is an anime where the eccentric supernatural characters show how down to earth they are and how the normal everyday people are way stranger then they appear. This show has something for everyone to love, multiple romances to get invested in, mysteries to keep you engaged, shocking revelations, great actions and much much more. This show is so much more than the average show, unique characters, unique setting, unique plot this show is great and I believe everyone can find something to love.

I might be a little biased but damn did I love this series. I came across this entirely by chance-- someone was asking for recommendations for something similar to Baccano and aside from the abundant answers of boku no pico, someone recommended a series by the same person, Durarara!! They recommender went as far to say that it was even better than Bacanno if you can ignore the fujoshi shit. I don't think I ever saw Durarara!! come up again for a couple months after that so I guess it was lucky I'd seen it when I did. I tried to get into Baccano butit just wasn't something I was in the mood for at the time so I tried Durarara and easily fell into it.


The first episode did not particularly woo me as much as I had hoped but it was definitely not hard to get into. My immediate allure to the show was actually Izaya and his "love" of people. He loved the kinds of reactions people had to just about anything, and while I like to think I am not much of a sadist, I can appreciate the idea. People are interesting creatures. Though I'd read the synopsis, I hoped for a lot more of Izaya and I was not disappointed as he peppered the show, observing and manipulating others acting as an informant and often having street lights thrown at him by an enraged Shizuo, who I was also a fan of but not necessarily paired together. I loved Shizuo's softer moments with Celty.


I'll say this now, I absolutely loved the soundtrack. Both opening themes are a great listen all by themselves and I often find myself youtubing the ost for some nice background music. Some of it is so simple but pretty memorable as being unmistakeably from Durarara!!. 


I'd also like to point out, I am utterly surprised as I had watched the subbed version first, but I was thoroughly impressed by Simon's Russian accent in the dub. Out of everyone I was most concerned about his voice and it just so happened he sounded exactly as I imagined. I can remember some dubs going as far as changing the nationalities of characters to warrant a different kind of accent (I swear it was One Piece but don't quote me...) but this was a delightful surprise!


Something I loved about the characters was it made everyone seem like they were important. If they were shown once, they were always brought up again in a later scenario in unexpected ways. I liked that side characters got a few times to be fleshed out, rather than being a typical filler character that is mentioned once and never again. They may not have been main characters or friends of the main characters but they were still given a role that would tie into another main character's storyline eventually and I have the hugest boner for that kind of shit. 


The story is great and has a lot going on the entire time and I loved the shit out of it because almost all of it was wrapped up in the end. I know I loved it but the producers were not going to kid themselves-- they knew they weren't going to get more than 24 episodes. So instead of leaving open questions or cliffhangers at the end for a possible sequel, it was all wrapped up rather nicely for the most part I think. There's the color wars, the Dollars and their origin, Saika the demon blade, Celty the headless rider searching for her missing head, the human kidnapping, trafficking and experimentation in a secret lab facility, all hidden beneath a cute boys doing gay things facade. And I loved it.


Yes, they never wrapped up what on earth was going on with the human experimenting fully, and yes they never went into Izaya's past (and I'm sure a few others) but I felt that everything else was done spot on and honestly, it was enough for me. There was so much going on I hardly noticed. And isn't it fitting that as a man that is in the business of digging up dirt on high profile people that he himself have a low one? Just a thought.

*No spoilers, only details from the description and the summary of the anime.
 But the P.S. might feel like a spoiler, even though it's completely unimportant*
This is one of the best anime I've ever seen! So you know where this review is heading, right?
Story 9/10
Although this season contains the first and largest arc of the Light Novels, it is still formed from smaller stories that intervene in the most unexpected ways and for the most unexpected reasons! This is the reason it might look confusing in the beginning. But when you get to know the characters, it all gets into place!
Art 8.5/10
The art is original,but does not stray off from the classic anime animation! Detailed backgrounds, vivid colors even though it's ahas a few darker points and the characters, even if they had the same hair and eye color, you would still be able to tell them apart! All perfect blend for a mystery-comedy anime.


Sound 8.5/10


Apart from the great job of the seiyuu, it's not something amazing or mind blowing. But it's very very good, matching sound and setting. The opening and ending songs are the kind of songs I would have on my phone. The ost when it comes to fight and scheming scenes presents a great result!


Character 10/10


Ok, the characters are so many, so different and so well created! I don't know how they managed to give a back story to all of them and you come to need them all in your story! There are crazy motives for the plot to evolve, from being utterly bored to looking for a lost head. 

It also includes one of the coolest female characters I've seen (Celty) and one of my most favorite couples!


Enjoyment 10/10


Enough said! I just cannot describe how much I enjoy the black motorcycle, the fights between Shizuo and Izaya and the difference between the night and day life! I love how they mix up seemingly normal, every day characters with urban legends and dark alleys! It's just perfect! 


Overall 9.5/10


I am tempted to give it a 10/10, but I don't want to sound too soft. So a 9.5 it is! The quality is high, the work of the production is excellent and the result one of those anime that, in the end, doesn't make you feel silly for watching it!


I know how people say that Baccano (same creators, same philosophy) is better and objectively, it is. But I got more attached to Durarara! for some reason. 


P.S. There is a small cameo from Baccano.

"Durarara!!" is a fast paced anime with a very large cast. Very similar to Ryohogo Narita's other work "Baccano!". Within the mysterious city of Ikebukuro are the the entangled stories of a Dullahan working as an underground transporter, a mad scientist, gang leaders, a malicious information broker, his worst enemy who has the strength to lift a vending machine and throw it across the street, and the protagonist Ryuugamine, Mikado who's excited to become a part of the madness. 
   Due to the fast pace and many storylines this is definitely not an anime for first timers but if you're looking for achange of pace from your traditional story and some of the most interesting characters you'll ever see than "Durarara!!" is for you. \n\n
 The action scenes, music, and overall look of the anime are fantastic and surprisingly fresh. Just watch the first episode, you will be hooked.

Durarara was amazing, from the second I started watching it. I've watched it all the way though three times I think, but the first time I watched it, and I loved the opening, good music great art, and I felt that the characters were going to develop nicely. So I pulled an all nighter in the middle of the week and missed school. I just couldn't help myself. This show is definitely one of my all time favorites.

Before season 2 starts in January, I would like to revisit the series that I really like personally. That is Durarara. A interconnected narrative with a large cast similar to Baccano (same author). So let’s go!
STORY:
Durarara is all about the Black Biker, a dullahan, a headless dullahan. But that is not it, Durarara is all about the Black Biker and the people surrounding her. Although she is not the main protagonist, her presence is the reason why the conflicts in Durarara exist. This is key to all of Narita’s works (the author). This is kind of narrative is exciting and enthralling. This ambitious narrative ishard to do. Interconnected storylines and large cast are really hard things to make the story good. But the atmosphere and its premise makes Durarara pretty accessible. It makes mystery and makes it interesting that we bother enough to continue watching to know what and why is this happening. Durarara is very good at doing its own thing.


CHARACTER:


Like I said earlier, Durarara isn’t just about the Black Biker or Mikado. It focuses on many characters each episode and the story is divided to the 3 protagonist. The Harima Mika arc focuses in Mikado, while the Slasher arc focuses in Sonohara, lastly Yellow Scarves arc focuses in Kida. A large cast is typically hard to handle but Durarara is good at this. Not only shows that it has good character writing but it manages to develop their characters further even in a span of 24 episodes. Durarara is good at making its characters interesting while making the story interesting too. 


VISUALS:


Brains Base manages to do not only a faithful adaptation but also an innovative one. It has smooth and liquid animation that makes everything better. Little to no animation mistakes or flaws. Aesthetics are good. Fight choreography is decent at best. Personally I like Durarara’s character designs. Well, Brains Base manages to pull an interesting adaptation.


MUSIC/SOUND:


Durarara’s music is amazing. OST are nothing special but its openings and endings are really very good. Uragiri no Yuuyake is one of the catchiest opening themes I have heard. Its endings are good in their own way but I don’t have much to say about it. Complication stands as my favorite anime opening of all time. Graceful lyrics and awesome instrumental. I am not a music critic so I don’t have much to say. Seiyuus did a very good job in portraying the emotions of their respective characters thru voice. 


FINAL VERDICT:


Durarara is ultimately a great show. It manages to do everything it tries to do. It makes an interesting premise that people look forward to. It is an amazing interconnecting narrative that makes use of its characters to the fullest. Durarara makes its own thing interesting, to the very best.


Story - 9

Art - 9

Sound - 10

Character - 9

Enjoymeny - 9

Overall - 9

Expect the unexpected: that phrase doesn't come truer than in Durarara! This anime starts and leads up to an amazing story, backplot, twists and turns that'll leave your stomach in knots. However, towards the end the story falls flat on its face, devoid of deeper meaning or any sort of audience connection as the inner theme prematurely bursts out, forcing you down the gullet of paranoia and a little disappointment.
The story was told in such a fascinating way, it was hard to grasp at first. It simply wasn't told from a main protagonists point of view, but split among multiple major and minor characters thatall told their individual stories that intertwined like spaghetti. This made for an interesting roller coaster ride: you never knew whose story you would listen to in the episode. The whole three faction conflict, mixed with string-pulling and several interesting characters was most invigorating. Several interesting backgrounds and circumstances were revealed, with each characters' problems laid bare from their internal struggles. Loved it. However, this also made for a bit of confusion: sometimes, the characters had flashbacks or the episode wasn't necessarily in chronological order; but that ALSO made it so exhilarating, holding onto the edge of your seat. But what irked me the most was the build-up: suspense, pent up from the start of the anime, built constantly and continuously throughout the anime as more and more information was revealed. The ending, by far, was the most anticlimatic ending I've ever seen. Ever. In the history of everything I've watched (which I know I haven't watched a lot, but STILL). I was literally so disappointed at the ending, it was like watching a balloon deflate instead of hearing a loud BANG from a needle stabbed suddenly. I wanted to strangle myself......


TLDR: I give the story a 7, because it was yes, overall it was an interesting and new story; however, the ending disappointed the heck out of me.


The art, however, did not disappoint me in the least. The detail was gorgeous, and if anyone has watched Baccano! before, look for the hidden messages and various details within Durarara. It'll surprise you.... Overall, I enjoyed the characters' lanky feel and the facial expressions were fantastic. There was little the art skimped on; the colors were smooth and flowing, the weather reflected the mood. I know this sounds cliche, but I've seen other animes skimp on the detail, so I give credit where credit is due. 


On man, the songs and background mood music really were astounding. The OP I loved; it was fast-paced and jazzy, just like the overall mood. The ED was pop-sounding and rock-influenced; I loved the ED much more. During key moments in the anime, the music dropped to this foreboding track, and it made me feel much more engrossed. During the happy moments, there was cheerful, peppy song that really deflated the mood and made it bearable again.


The characters were, how can I say, either fantastically engrossing or stubbornly irritating. The main protagonist really grated my nerves for much of the story. Mikado continually refused to impress me, and that contributed to the anime's general decline; however, his backstory sort of explains his situation..... Masaomi, his best bud that carries a dark secret, is a well-developed character that really showed bravado and fortitude, doing everything right and more. A great character. Anri, who also harbors an ominous secret, also could have been one of the best characters of the whole series; however, she really never lives up to my expectations and constantly led me on, only to crash my dreams. The black rider was AMAZING; she really carried the story's underlying message well. Most of the other minor characters, like the hilarious mad-scientist Shinra, the hard-to-understand Shizuo, and the stolid Kadota really packed a punch. It's just two of the main characters really dragged the rest of the crew down, making for an iffy cast.


All in all, what made me so mad was this had so much potential, only to really trip on that one banana peel of character development and story climaxing. Everything else was superb and top-notch; but certain elements really made such a great anime so depressingly.....disappointing. There really is no other word, but I wasn't left with this glowing feeling of satisfaction, just emptiness. Who knows? This may not be your cup of tea; it sure wasn't mine. It was refreshingly entertaining and certainly different than your average Joe anime, but it fell far from the bulls-eye. After all, everything in the end stays the same.

Durarara!! took me by surprise. I went into it fully expecting... well... crap. I had heard that it was a mix of many genres, and nine times out of ten, those kind of anime end up being trainwrecks. I enjoyed Durarara!! a lot more than I thought I would, and I'm hear to tell you just why I did.
__________________________________________________________________________
STORY: 6/10
The biggest problem I have with the plot of Durarara!! is how slow it is to start, and how hard it is to get into it. I found myself extremely frustrated trying to get through the first five episodes, and not understanding a thing that washappening. The concept of it itself is just plain stupid, and would have people stay away, for the sole reason of how weird it sounds. A kid transfers schools, and a black biker. "Ooooooooh how scary." But the thing is - how many other shows make a bold leap by offering a unique plot like that? Not many, that's for sure. That is why I felt obliged to keep pushing. And boy, am I glad I did. The plot picks up quickly after that, and I found myself on the edge of my seat in excitement a couple times. The ending as well, was a great end to a great series, and left room for more seasons in case the main series was successful. The start cost a lot of points, but the plot of Durarara!! isn't as bad as it seems like.

__________________________________________________________________________

ART: 8/10


The art style in Durarara is pretty dang good. The scenery in the background is the main selling point, as it secretly makes the show look beautiful, as it is not TOO detailed so it clashes with the characters, but is just detailed enough to make the backround beautiful and the characters stand out. It's also very realistic, which I liked, it accurately depicts a modern day city. As for the animation, it isn't Madhouse or Ufotable, but, it is definitely good. The action scenes, or more specifically, when Izaya whips out his knife or when Shizuo swings around a traffic sign, are well done and make the scene more... epic. I don't have many complaints when it comes to the art of the series.

__________________________________________________________________________

SOUND: 6/10


"WOAH WOAH WOAH! SOUND?! SIX?! THIS GUY HAS NO IDEA WHAT HE'S TALKING ABOUT!" I don't blame you for reacting that way. I would have too. But... as awesome as the opening and ending themes are.... the actual soundtrack doesn't hold up. Well, lets start off with the opening themes. The first opening... IS AMAZING. I didn't skip it, not even once. It perfectly fits with the show giving it a gangster type feel, which is plain epic. The song gets a 9/10 from me, it's just great all around. The second opening... doesn't hold up. It's not bad, in fact I would call it good! It's just... such a step down from the first one that I skipped it every time, wishing the song had never changed. For endings, I was also impressed. I loved the first ending, in fact, it might be the only ending theme I've never skipped. It was so good that I was worried it might make me want the end of the episode to come faster... but it didn't. Just PERFECT! The second ending though... was a massive step down. It was standard, and before this review, I hadn't even listened to the whole thing once. As for the actual soundtrack, it was blended well with the anime and used right, to make the comedic scenes funnier, and the dramatic scenes more astounding. Still though, none of the soundtracks were good enough for me to want to hear them again after listening to them in the anime. Also, near the last couple of episodes, they began to be... repetitive. A minor problem, but still a problem.

__________________________________________________________________________

CHARACTER: 8/10


Bravo Narita, BRAVO! The characters of Durarara!! are PHENOMENAL! I loved almost every character, they're all so unique, and they all have their own secrets, even the seemingly bland protagonist was AMAZING! THIS is the reason Durarara!! is a must watch, and everyone needs to know! If I had one complaint, it would be that a few of their names are hard to remember, but WHO CARES! IZAYA! CELTY! SHIZUO! SIMON! KIDA! I LOVE THEM ALL!.... is what I would like to say. Still as an analyst, the characters of DRRR!! are great, but they aren't the best I've ever seen. If anything about them bothered me, it would be their designs, which can sometimes make them not stick out from the crowd of unidentified supporting characters. It's as if, every character is balanced, and there isn't one better than the other. 

__________________________________________________________________________

OVERALL: 7/10


A seven might seem like a low score, but trust me, Durarara!! is worth it. It was a good anime, nothing groundbreaking, but, I would recommend it to most people, and most people will like it! Now, boot up a website and give it a try, and trust me, it won't just be a waste of time!

Okay, so I'm going to try and write a balanced review here, because I fucking adore this anime and Manga. So, why do I love it?
Welp.
I adore the characters, from the quirky and cute to the nasty and strong, this anime has a wide range of relatable characters that I fell in love with. Par Izaya.  It even has my all time favourite character, Shizuo motherfucking Heiwajima,  which is now a body pillow on my bed. I know, I need a life. 
Even now after about seven years after watching it, I constantly re-read the manga on my shelf. 
The setting was somethingfresh to me, as it took place in downtown Tokyo, yet made it feel like it was just like a little village where everyone knew each other. Which was nice.\n\n
I didn't know that the original Durarara story came from a Light Novel, so with the back and forth story telling and fast exposition, I found it a bit stunting. There were parts were the text moved very quickly and being a non-Japanese speaker I had to change to an English dub just to follow the story. Personally, I'm very picky when it comes to English Dubs, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was a good dub, with decent actors. \n\n
Personally, this is my favourite anime of all time. I strongly recommend it to anyone because there's something for everyone.

GOD BLESS THIS ANIME AND ALL OF ITS SEASONS!!!! 10/10
This anime has got all - drama, comedy, adventury, fantastic elements and all you need for enjoying is to turn on the 1st episode of 1st season and then you don't even notice as you have already finished the last episode of season 4. Overall - ENJOY, ENJOY, ENJOY!!!!

**finally got strenght enough to finish the last 4 episodes....holy shit that was a headache - felt like a chore**
Durarara!! is an anime about ..... About what ? This is the taste that stays in my mouth, the more I delve into the plot. There are so many characters, with such bland backstories, that the plot itself, which unfolds episodically, exists for the simple fact of making the anime keep going, despite having no destination. The narrative wants to be a web of interconnected revelations, which in the end, feels entangled. Each episode in which we have a small (and forced) flashback to try toemerge some connection of the viewer with a character, the series sinks in personality development and ecstasy of revelations. A world and actions that need to be explained by the characters themselves in each episode, what each gang does or did and why, in that way, makes this universe's image less convincing. Finally, this "gang war" becomes the main focus of the anime shortly after the fragile introductions. But anyway, is the plot about that? Or about something else?


Is it about high school friendship? Yes. But without the high school life itself - the 3 student protagonists have beaten personalities that do not evolve. They exchange very few deep or thought-provoking dialogues.

Is it supernatural? Yes. But that is lost trying to merge the supernatural with the real. It presents itself in an original way in the first episodes, to become irrelevant over time.

Is it about fights and urban life? Yes. But the more you are obliged to hear about "city life" and how things are, the more boring and tedious are the events - for example, when they morph in extraordinarily weak or expendable moments of action ( looking at you, fight with "gray zombies" with knives).


This anime could be about a lot of things, but it wants so much to show the variety of themes and to reveal the hidden and ugly urban life, which serves us a medium, uninteresting (with an almost childlike vision), with shells of characters that do not bloom. You hate violence and still make use of it because "you do not know how to be otherwise", not only is schizophrenic, as it is a cliché (believe it or not, this is the face of the character Heiwajima Shizuo). The mysteries are unmasked in a simple and predictable way - and in some cases as of Celty Sturluson (the "supernatural" character who is a headless creature, called dullahan) in an anticlimatic way. Relationships are superficial, without substance.

In fact, the only character that caught my eye and seemed different to the point of being explored was the supporting Brezhnev Semyon. A black russian man working in a sushi restaurant. And yet, I feel that if they had turned the spotlight on him at some point, they would probably end up making him less interesting than he appeared to be.


Only with this amount of information, you can get an idea that Durarara !! covers various corners of different genres. A great variety puree, that tastes like nothing.


The good points are the audiovisual and environment. Often the scenery and animation has an interesting tone. But this idea of ​​highlighting the protagonists in graying the rest of the extras only passes the assumption of cretinism of the production.

The songs, in fact, are the best the series could offer me. The 2 opening songs were really good (can't say that about the endings tho).


I would give a 4.0 / 10.0: it is average/bad.


The anime is not bad - it seems that it tries to take itself seriously, but afraid of really being serious.



I also tried watching Baccano, but fell asleep in the third episode. I guess that I just don't like these shounen that tries to look like seinen. It's childish, indeed. Durarara!! is the shounen that thinks is edgy and profound but just sounds like a teenage ranting. Probably the target audience are people under their 20's.

I would recommend to those who like something that is different, but at the same time does not go too deep - it's just shallow.

durarara was on my plan to watch for a long time and i had high expectations. to be honest, in the first half of the anime i was sure i would give a lower score than 8, because the story made me roll my eyes at some points and i had the feeling of being "too old for something". but as the show went by i was more and more into it and soon i recognized that something about this anime made me genuinely like it, like that type of anime you remember watching and you get a nice warm feeling about it. art, characters,story were all in all enjoyable, but what really got me for some reason, is the sound. there was one specific melody that i always waited for and in my head it still sounds sweet and nostalgic

( and I never hate anime this is the exception)

Durarara!! is a story that takes place in Ikebukuro, Tokyo, really focusing on no group of characters in particular, but instead spreading its focus on the entire cast. Featuring characters ranging in personality from an uncanny level of eccentricity to a calm and often quirky lifestyle, Durarara!! brings an interesting amount of contrast to the characters of the show, in a degree that is seen in very few anime. Just as there is no main focus on any of the characters, there is also no main focus on any single plot of Durarara!!.
Despite having such a broad cast, the director, Takahiro Omori does an outstandingjob of utilizing each and every character. All of the characters are extremely unique, and very well developed, providing an excellent cast, which supplements the various plots rather well. All the characters are very likeable, and capable of making moments of comedy, drama, and awe.\n
Durarara!! has an extremely well developed plot, which makes excellent use of all of its side stories, eventually weaving them all into one conclusive story that will leave any viewer amazed. Among these side stories are Celty’s quest for her missing head, the investigation of the “slashing incidents”, the fights between the “color gangs” and the “Dollars”, the search for the strongest person in Ikebukuro, and the daily adventures of Ryuugamine, Kida, and Sonohara.\n
Celty is a “dullahan” which is a headless fairy from Irish mythology. She left Ireland with a scientist and his son Shinra, to move to Ikebukuro as she thought that might be where her head was. During the story, she lives in an apartment with Shinra, using her free time to search for her lost head. Shinra is an underground surgeon who operates on people injured in gang fights, or people who don’t have the insurance to cover the required operation.\n
The “Slasher” is a mysterious figure who has been going around the city killing random people, and causing an uproar in the underworld, as each gang thinks that the enemy gangs are in charge of the slasher, and that their targeting the opposing gangs.\n
The three major gangs in Ikebukuro have re-emerged from a time of peace, after the “Yellow Scarves” and “Blue Squares” fought a gang war, and exhausted themselves. The “Dollars”, a gang formed online, have risen to prominence on the streets of Tokyo, subduing themselves in the gang fights occurring throughout the city.\n
Newspaper writers around the city have found themselves intrigued in the search for the strongest person in Ikebukuro, as everyone around town has been talking about the fighting between the gangs. Simon from Russia Sushi, Heiwajima Shizuo the bartender, Celty, the Slasher, and an informant named Izaya, are all being pursued by newspaper writers to find out which one of them is really the strongest in Ikebukuro.\n
Then come the daily adventures of Ryuugamine, Kida, and Sonohara. The three are all students at Raira Academy, and seem to get involved in all of the side stories presented throughout the anime. Ryuugamine is a well mannered student, who moved from a small country village to Tokyo in hope of living a more exciting life. Kida, is an eccentric and perverted teenager, and is one of the reasons that Ryuugamine moved to Tokyo, as he asked his old friend to come and visit the big city. Sonohara is a timid and rather quiet girl who tags along with Ryuugamine and Kida, and is the center of the love triangle that the three form together.\n
Durarara!! has a very refreshing sound track, which seems to use a full ensemble of jazz instruments, including the piano, and a variety of brass instruments, which provides high, sharp notes to magnify the surprise of the moment. The stand up bass is also used very well, as it is able to create a feeling of a calm and laid back setting. The opening and ending soundtracks are nothing special, but they fit the feeling of the anime well, so there’s no reason to complain. The voice actors are very fitting in their roles, each one voicing their characters in a way that accentuates their personalities.\n
The artwork in Durarara!! is a good change of pace from the usual shiny haired characters of most anime. The hair of the characters is unique in the sense that each characters hair has several strands out of place, but not in a way that makes the art look sloppy, just more realistic. Another touch that I found to be nice was that any of the random bystanders were a colorless shade of gray, which highlighted the important characters, and added a nice amount of contrast to each scene.\n
While Durarara!! may have started off a bit slow, it was for a good reason, as the beginning of the series was used to introduce the many plots and characters in a minimal period of time. As things pick up, Durarara!! reaches a level of enjoyment that has only been matched for me by a select number of anime. When all the plots are strung together, I find it hard to believe that anyone would not appreciate the masterful execution of the plot. Durarara!! is a series that I would recommend to anyone who likes any of the genres of Durarara!!, or for that matter anyone who wants to see a well executed anime. There’s a reason that Durarara!! is already being talked about as the 2010 anime of the year.\n

Durarara!! is a anime that got known and nowadays has a nice rate among the viewers. 
In general this anime is good, although there are some points that i would like to talk about. 
Story: 9/10. If there is story more complex than this one? Well at least i did not saw one more complex than this one yet. This story is not a story but a lot of small stories together. If this anime is good, it's because of the plot twists. I would like to tell you the main theme here but honestly i can´t. There are just so many that you canchose by your self. If i had to choose, i would say that there are 2 main stories here on the first show, then there a lot of small ones, but they are all related! And this is why i loved this show. Usually we see a background story that is the same for everyone and then we have the development of it with the time. Here ? Well such things happens to although in a different way. The most interesting fact is that they can tell us 4 5 ou even more stories at once, everyone happens at the same time and everyone end up being conected somehow. So basically the way that the stories are developed is totally different. At least it was the first time that i saw such thing. 


Above all this, the story is original, creative and we also get an idea of how is it like living in a city.

I did not found any plot holes, the all story fits together and there are no missing parts. Everything is properly explained, so if you see an episode and if you think you are lost, don´t worry it is normal on this show. They will tell you everything right in the next episode. 


I don´t tell you one more thing that made this anime so interesting, otherwise i would be spoiling.. check that out for yourself. This anime is full of secrets and it is nice to figure them out as we go through the story. 


Art: (8/10). In gerenal it is good. The background is OK. The character design is OK. There are no bad points here, just small good ones xD. 


Sound: (8/10). I think that the first opening is brutal. Really nice to hear and fits well with the anime. The rest is cool for it's purpose but nothing else. While in some animes, some OST can be memorable and we will never forget them, here it doesn´t happen. Everything is relatively okay, no big deal but that doesn´t mean they are bad. 


Character: (9/10). Individually they all look good characters but not good enough for a 9/10. All together? Well that is another thing. Like in the story, here we don´t see 1 2 3 or even 4 characters getting a decent development. Remember we have 24 episodes, although they explore pretty well more than 9 characters ! I do not remember them all, but i do know for sure 9 characters got a nice development plus all the others that i'm not remembering at the moment. 


Now you ask? But having so many characters being developed at the same time doesn´t make the story confuse? NO. Yes you may get lost but don´t worry, as I said and I repeat, they all are connected. If one character gets development, it's because that character is important for the plot. Every character here has their own way to be and everyone has a pretty decent past. Plus with the twists that we see in some characters, just makes the story and the entire anime much more cool. I would say that this multiple development of plot and characters makes this anime a anime that everyone must see. In fact we don´t find such thing in other shows. At least i didn´t. 


Enjoyment: (7/10). There is a bad point of having so many stories and characters being developed at once. The anime is boring for the first part, until the 10th episode it's hard to watch. After that it gets more interesting but still it is not enough to "pay" for the first part. But don´t let this turn you down. Now the second show is being released and it's just getting better and better. When we get used to the way that they develop things, we just realize how cool it is and how interesting it gets. 


This anime i think it will be on my memory for a long time, the plot is crazy, the characters also are crazy and the twists .. oh my this anime has the best plot twist that i've ever saw ! And i'm not over reacting. Usually we see one or 2 big twists. Here, well i lost my count. 



So if you are looking for something completely out of the boundaries, check this one. It is amazing how the plot and how the characters are developed and how everything ends up together.

Durarara!! is a compilation of stories with various highlights that brings different view and interpretation to the viewers. A content that evolved and has been developed inside a so-called society named ‘Ikebukuro’. It contains a balanced pace where the occurrences of the story are being told in a fast-slow manner while adding lots “I mean LOTS” of interesting plot to bend.
Beginning with its introduction, at first, it may be some typical storytelling of events that we might have seen before but when the story rolls you may be attracted on its different way of introducing characters and events that seems promising. 
The show holds somany interesting plots and laughable gag which became amusing and a big factor why this show proves that it’s different than the other shows. Also, the show introduces characters and events in such a way that it picks up the good vibes, episode by episode, having a feeling of shock and awe while being presented to give great amusement. 


Obviously, it stands out on creating wonderful plots, connecting each of the dots, twisting some important arcs that have a capability to excite viewers, and giving an experience throughout the environment and scenes that became worth while. All I can say is that they’ve done a great job on developing such plots but there is quite a flaw to it; it may lacks on impact, some of the highlights seems fading away without a trace, and a possibility that the thrill found on the other arcs would not be the same or equal, so up to this point I find it quite a problem as some of them became weak.


Ikebukuro is simply a neighborhood where great events and mysteries are bound to happen. Consisting of people with different attitudes, status, and form of living, the involvement of these characters truly shines as it liven up the surroundings and giving amazing feedback that brings quite an attraction for the viewers.


Honestly, without such characters, this show wouldn’t be that great as these characters are piled to meet the expectation of the viewers such as Izaya, Shizuo, Celty, the trio (Masaomi, Mikado and Anri), and also with the involvement of all the characters. Arc by arc, such characters have created good stories to tell and to see which revolves between main and supporting characters and within the society itself, by that it maintains the show to its high level of excitement.  


It seems that not only the story and characters correlates but also the art and theme gives fascinating view which is truly a nice pair throughout the whole series. If you’re fond of a nice and detailed art, this series would fit for you as it contains a clean and bright art within a gloomy and peculiar scene. It outshines and adds effects that bring pleasure and good ambiance for the audience to feel.


Also, adding these great aspects (voice emphasis, sound effects, background sounds) it brings the series at its fullest, as these helps to appreciate more what is being told and being presented on such scenes. Don’t forget the sounds for the OP Theme & ED Theme which also puts such effort to give lovely and melodic music for the intros and ends.


As an overall, the series contains many interesting plots that give various level of excitement, a nicely animated and drawn that will attract viewers from watching it, nice soundtracks and effects that makes the series more attractive and fun, creative character attitudes and design that helps the story became more appealing. It has a nice package of entertainment that will vary to the taste of the viewer one after the other.


In the end it is worth while watching this but for me I just truly enjoyed only half of the total series or some picked arcs while the others is quite a filler just to be entertained until it meets its climax.

''Becuase the world isn't as bad as you think''

There were many times that I was like ''what the heck'' but you will find out everything by the end!

I like both animation and direction of Durarara!!
