Personal Comment: 
- This anime is probably one of the best anime I have seen in my whole life, everything about it from 'bad guys' to 'good guys' trying to fight each other from the people behind the scene. This anime is amazing because there are so much that you wouldn't suspect, though I did not give it 10/10 simply because I just wanted it to have more episodes. If I were to be biased this anime is 'perfect' not that most of you guys would agree but this anime can really but you at the edge of your seat. The anime gives a lotof twist and turns, from bad to worse which is soo entertaining because you are just dying to see what will happen next. Izaya (the main mastermind of... everything) is just so scary that I actually detest the guy though  he doesn't he really exist (*.*), but surely you guys are thinking that I'm taking that guy tooo seriously but yeah if you have seen the anime then you can understand why I'm like this, but if you have not seen this anime then it's a "Must Watch" because I garuntee that you'll enjoy it. 


Story - 10/10 

- This anime's story is... to put it simple - perfect. If your wondering why, it's because of most of all the chair-edging scenes such as... the scene of all three heroin's fnding about the truth about each other about episodes 23-24. The story is well constructed, and it does not leave with thoughts like "where did guy come from" or "what happened to ... " because episodes 1-5 show's a great demonstration of showing what  happened from different prespective's of each character, therefore making it interesting and it allows that auidience to take interest in other characters rather then just always seeing the main heroins. Shizua and Izaya, the two overpowered 'Dudes' show great interesting characterisation, because not only they are from the same gang "dollars" but they try to kill each other everytime they see each other, but it's mostly Shizua doing all the chasing. This creates some kind of comic relief because this shows to the audience that if these two make any encounter, it's automatic that something good or bad will happen and that Shizua seems to have "gay feelings" for Izaya because he just won't leave him alone... But yeah overall the different gangs "yellow scarfs" , "blue squares" and "Dollars" are interesting gangs because they shows different kinds of reactions towards society, 'Blues' - violent; "yellows" - Average gang (just hanging out) and "Dollars" - a bunch of people who made a group.. (sooo like a youth group?) who do good things... (mostly). 

Lastly celty (the rider) was an interesting character on this anime, because she gave a lot of hints which makes her and interesting character which made the story more interesting, because she... is... uhh... funny?  yet... serious... the fact that she's so intimidating but shes so 'girly' (sorry if I sounded sexist) makes an interesting character to have in the story, and the fact that they gave a little bit of her history made it easier for us audience to understand her. I didn't want to go over the story too much, because it might spoil it for some people who hasn't watched it.


Art - 8/10

- The art was pretty good, the way everyone was drawn was pretty amazing, though unlike most anime they don't have any scenes which they turn into this "chibi-like" character to shows there emotions of, happy, shy, angry etc... but I'm not much of a fan of those anyways. The arts of the motor bike, shadows... and evil 'things' were very well made, and it wasn't a predictable of what might they look like. Furthermore it's very unique of what they wear, like Shinra's father (a old dude, that wears a gas mask?!) was rather funny because he wasn't really that important in the story but the way he acted fitted perfectly to what he wore. on the other hand, the fact that celty is wearing all black biker clothing, but a cat like helment totally confuses you if shes really a grim ripper or a "dullahan" (a fallen valkyire). Most of the art were pretty believable because everything seemed to really fit in the anime, if your wondering what I mean, the scenary of what's happening around the anime, "a run-down area" fit's perfectly of an anime filled with gangs. Furthermore they make it seem more realistic by making some character's live in a run-down area, or place because unlike some anime's, some have a run-down place but for some reason they have a super clean room and a perfectly tidy enviroment for them to live in. But yeah the art is amazing, but if your wondering why I didn't make it 9 or 10/10 because the fact that it's got high school students wasn't really anything new, therefore it wasn't interesting unlike the other characters...


Sound - 8/10

- This... I don't know why they have this in the "reviewing" but... the sound is great? I guess, but the sound actually depends on where and what you watch it. But then again they might be talking about the sound of the characters... and sound effects? I don't have much for this... because I didn't really focus on sounds... but straight to the point 


japanese Version - I didn't watch the Jp version therefore I do not know if the Jp dubbing is good.


English Version - The dubbing was fantasric, everything fit's perfectly from the description of the character.


Effects - The effects were alright, not amazing but average. 


Character - 9/10 

The characters were all amazing and fun to watch, however some did not have as much attention unlike the others, such as the police which celty is extremely scared of. He made an appearance as one of the new cops chasing after celty which shown just how powerful a cop can really be, however after that episode, we never seen him again, or more preferable just not noticed. The only time I really notice that cop, is when celty panics or the point of view focuses on this special cop. Most of the characters, were interesting ranging from: 


Celty: a 'Black Rider', 'Dullahan', 'Grim reaper' 

- A rider which doesn't have head, with black shadow thingies coming out of her neck, and a motorbike which makes horse sounds, make her one of the wierdest but interesting character. Oh and she's afraid of aliens... which is pretty funny because she doesn't have a head...


Shizuo: a 'bar-tender', 'Strongest man in Ikubukuro',

- An Over powered dude, which get's pissed so easily, call him stupid and he'll send you flying 500m in the air. He apparantly doesn't like violence, which is hard to believe because everything single episode we see him or  even a glimpse of him, something or someone is flying or broken. His blue glasses make's him somewhat "awesome" and he has gay feelings for Izaya (that's what I thnk)


Izaya: a 'informer'... 'King'

- He Manipulates everyone and everything as he pleases, he is smart and he has commando like skills to jump long distances and has great accuracy with his knifes. He wears blackish clothing and laughs crazily or act's crazy from time to time, he doesn't seem to understand "fear" and he doesn't care if his about to die, he is always calm in any kind of situation. He is able to gain trust from people, and he just manipulate's in doing his dirty work, he feels "humans" are his sense of his entertainment, therefore he is constantly causing distress towards... Everyone.


Anri: a 'Slasher' 

- She is a lot alike to the main character of blood C Saya. She has big boobs, wears glasses and gives away this feeling that you shouldn't piss her off, two people like her Mikado and Masaomi. She can release saika from her right hand and once's she slashes you she can control you. She is a shy character therefore she doesn't say much from time to time, she is a skilled swordsman and doesn't seem to be intimidated from getting surrounded. She's scary.


Masaomi: a "leader of yellow scarfs" 

- he has street fighting skills, he is very flirty and he doens't care what kind of girl he flirts so long as they're cute. He switches personality depending on who his with, his a coward but conquers that at the last episodes. He doesn't specialise in any kind of weapon, so long you can hold and smash with it it's good for him. His best friend is Mikado and like's Anri.


Mikado: a "Leader of the Dollars" 

- he doesn't have any kind of fighting talents nor is he extremely smart and manipulative like Izaya, but he is your average school boy. He wants his life to be adventurous and he reacts heroicly if his friend is in trouble, he also controls the entire group "Dollars" through a chat room. 



Enjoyment - 9/10

- I loved this whole anime so great, enjoyed every single episode and I wish it can have more episodes. It took me 2 days to finish this anime all the episodes, you might think I'm addicted to this, but yeah it was that good I didn't want to leave my seat. 


Overall - 9/10

- If you haven't seen this anime, then hate me if I have spoiled it for you. If you have seen this anime, then I hope you found my review helpful. 


Thank you Very much for reading this review, I hope you enjoy this anime and get addicted like I did. :D

Durarara!! is overall a very good series. It was one of the very animes I managed to get into in the very first episode. 
Story: I like the story a lot. Each episode is from a different character's viewpoint and tells a different tale from the last. The story mainly focuses on 3 average high school students and as you get farther into the show, you begin to see they aren't as average as you thought. They meet several characters along the way that either help them, fight against them, or are completely neutral. There were a lot of points in the story that youdidn't expect. The story deserves a 9/10 from me.


Att: The art is very unique and not like things you see in any other anime. Every background character is drawn as a gray, lifeless character, which in my opinion was a cool detail. The city itself was drawn beautifully, and all the main characters varied in design from one another. One of the characters spews dark matter from her neck, and that as well was drawn gorgeously, and did't use the same "flicker" pattern you see in most shows. 9/10


Sound: There is not a whole lot to say here, but the openings and endings were awesome as hell. My only complaint is the BGM's all sounded very similar and were too loud and sometimes sounded out the characters voices. 8/10


Character: All characters were very unique and had hidden pasts about themselves which was great development. The three high school students seem to be the same at the beginning, but eventually grow very far apart in terms of personality and characterization. The rest of the characters are all unique and great. 10/10


Enjoyment: The story was slow at some points and was a bit repetitive as well, but the last 6 or 7 episodes were really great and kept me interested at the very end. Because of the slowness on a few episodes, I give it a 9/10


Overall: 9/10


I recommend this anime to everyone as it is very good, except for the minor problems that I mentioned above. Thanks for reading my review of Durarara!! ^-^

This anime... I find it quite difficult to summarize my thoughts on this anime, as it is a show quite unlike anything else. However, I'll do my best. But first, I'd like to give a brief summary as to what this show is about, as when I was trying to decide whether to watch this show or not, I couldn't find a single synopsis/review that could do the show any justice in explaining what the hell it actually is. Note, this is partly because the show in and of itself, is told in a somewhat non-linear style, resulting in a hard-to-summarize plot, so most synopsizes(including the one provided here on the myanimelist page) just summarize the events of the first episode, in which absolutely nothing happens.




MINIMUM-SPOILER PLOT SYNOPSIS:

Ryugamine Mikado is a shy, laid back country kid, who dreams of a "different life", something less "ordinary". So when his best friend Masaomi Kida invites him to move to the big city, he accepts with no further delay. Once he arrives in the Ikebukuro district of Tokyo, where he is to be living and attending school, he begins learning of the secrets that this town has to offer, from the "colorless" color gang, to the "Black Rider", a motorcyclist who is rumored to have no head, and occasionally shows up riding a jet-black motorbike that makes no sound. His friend also introduces him to many people around town, amongst them an information broker with a penchant for creating pain and suffering, a "bartender" with a short fuse who likes throwing vending machines, and a group of four friends who are lead by the fearless Dotachin. Otakus included. Elsewhere in the city, people are going missing, a girl is having suicidal thoughts, a long separated couple seems to reunite, and a creature from celtic legends who happens to be a tsundere searches for her lost memories, not to mention head. Slowly, these paths start to converge, and secrets are unveiled. What will become of the mysterious place called Ikebukuro?





PLOT: My personal score: 7   General Score: 8


As you may have noticed, that synopsis sounded quite scattered. That's probably because the plot to the series itself is quite scattered, and a little hard to wrap your head around. However, don't get me wrong, that's not a bad thing at all. Heck, my favorite anime is Higurashi, which is wayyyyy more scattered than this, so, yeah. Now, let me make one point quite clear, the story is separated into two parts, one part consists of the first half of the show, which is quite a bit more lighthearted, focuses on the side characters more, and exudes badassery on sooo many levels. The other half focuses more on the main three characters (or at least the two others that weren't really touched upon in the first half, and is quite a bit darker. Personally, I liked the first half quite a bit more, mainly because of the plot twists, the converging story lines, episode 7, the creepy twisted relationships of the Yagiri family, and the fact that just about every single thing about it kinda just made you want to go AWWWWWW SHIIITTT. The whole gang war factor is downplayed significantly in the first half, while most of the second half revolves around that, or at least psychological gang wars. As I said, the first half focuses much more on the side characters than the main three. Two out of the main three characters are barley touched upon in the first half, while the other of them shines near the end, and shine he does. Episode 1 focuses on Mikado and introduces most of the main cast, Episode 2 focuses on a girl who doesn't show up in the rest of the series, and introduces another supporting character, ie. not one of the main three, but still a main character, episodes 3-5 focuses on Mikado at school/Dotachin & co./Celty/Dysfunctional Yagiri family, episode 6 is Dotachin, episode 7 is Shizuo... so on and so on. As you can see, it's pretty spread out, and then the storylines all come together, and when they do, it's a big OHMYGAWDTHATWASSOFREEKINGAWESOME. The second half almost entirely focuses on Anri and Kida, and drives up the melodrama by quite a lot, considering there was none in the first half. I found that this was probably because they wanted to keep the same epic feeling, but seeing as most of the plots introduced in the first half had already connected and resolved, they had to create a different kind of suspense, so they left you with the mysterious Anri, which was actually kinda fun, and the dour Kida, who was actually kinda boring.They also precede to introduce characters that never really do anything, and unlike Simon, the big black russian sushi chef, are kinda boring and get no screentime. Honestly, if you don't mind the plot holes left at the start of the season, and want to be left with the epic feeling that it gives off, I would stop watching Durarara!! after episode 12, at least until a second season comes out or something seeing as the second half doesn't have much to offer plotwise. The badassery that was so prominent in the first season is almost not present at all, and the suspense for the most part is also gone, replaced by attempted melodrama/tragic pasts, that don't go over as well. Although, honestly, the second half is probably worth watching, unless you really don't care about undeveloped characters, and enjoyed the first season mainly for the badass plot, which, by the way, is NOT what you should mainly enjoy it for, but I'll get to that in a bit.


OVERALL PLOT COMMENTS:


I personally found the first half that much better than the second half, although there will always be people out there who disagree with me, and really, it's still good, so be sure to watch it. The first half is much more akin to it's predecessor, Baccano!, and focuses more on suspense and the overall "epic" feeling, whereas the second half feels a bit more like a not quite as good retelling of Code Geass in gangland. Some people disagree with me, and like the second half more. Also, to keep from getting you really lost, at the beginning of every episode, they sum up previous important details, amongst the myriad of details you have been feed, to keep from getting you overly confused. I gave the story an overall 7, would have been better, but I felt the second half dragged it down, but overall, other people liked the second half a bit better than I did (though still agree that it wasn't as good), so I gave the general story rating an 8. Surprisingly little amount of gang violence, for a story about gang violence.




ART: My personal score: 8    General Score: 8


While I personally don't care much for the visual art in anime, and it tends to not factor much into my enjoyment of the series, I am well aware that it does matter to some people, so I'll talk. The art in this show is nothing really special, the animators occasionally gets a little lazy, but really, I found that when the art needed to be there, it really delivered. The scenes with the black bike were often quite nice to look at, and the character designs for the show were also quite beautiful. The city in the background, being a central figure, is also a scene to admire. Oh yeah, and Shizuo's fight scenes, I approve. Most people tend to agree here. This was a short enough paragraph, I have no need for overall comments.





SOUND: My personal score: 8    General Score: 9


This is split into two parts, voice acting and soundtrack. The voice acting is nothing superb, although there were some characters that great voices, Mika and Izaya namely. Oh yeah, and for all you dubbed fans out there, I checked out the dub as well, and although I still think almost all dubs suck, save Ghibli movies, the quality of this dub was actually pretty good, relatively speaking. As for the soundtrack, the BGM was very, very, very repetitive; I swear they played the same song at the beginning of every. single. faqing. episode. However, it was still quite enjoyable. Quite a feat I think, when the show seems to have a 5 song playlist. As for the opening/endings, I am in LOVE with the first opening. I really like the way they summed important details, and integrated that INTO the theme song. That was pretty badass. I hated the other opening and both endings though. However, I'm sure many of you will feel the other way around, seeing as I have a different taste in music (I like indie rock, etc.) and hate most mainstream pop/rock, whether it be Japanese or English.


OVERALL SOUND COMMENTS:


The voice acting was okay, the BGM was quite nice, but repetitive, and I thought the first opening was awesome. Most people like the other openings/endings though. Look em up on youtube maybe.




CHARACTER:  Personal Score: 10    General Score: 9


Now THIS is the reason you should be watching Durarara!! In the first episode, absolutely NOTHING happens plot wise, yet it is still quite engaging, and leaves you begging for more. Why? How? The characters. Almost every character in the series is likable, from the love/hate relationship you develop with Izaya, to the awe you feel in front of Shizuo, to how disgusted you are by the Yagiri family and their screwed up relationships, and yet how you feel strangely attracted to them at the same time. Hell, Seiji would of had his own badass moment if not for the fact that he was up against Shizuo. The headless Tsundere, the perverted underground doctor she lives with, the four musketeers, lead by the fearless Dotachin, with the Otakus and Car lover in tow, the big black russian sushi chef, they all make for great characters, whether or not they're actually important to the plot! The second episode focuses entirely on a character who makes no later appearances in the show, but is still kinda likeable, and we still suffer with her, even though she is only in one episode. Not to mention the main characters, Mikado, who shows us what badassery really means, Kida, who is a little hole of self regret, and Anri, who personally, I found was the character who was developed the best throughout the series. What the main characters are trying to say in Durarara!! , really, is that everyone has secrets, some of them might be terrible, but that shouldn't prevent their everyday lives, and everyday relationships. I found that Anri did this the best, Mikado did this pretty well, and Kida..... Oh Kida... I think we were supposed to feel bad for him sometime in the second half? I dunno. He worked as comic relief, not as tearjerker material. It might have worked if the story was written by Jun Maeda, but it wasn't, so oh well. The other characters more than made up for him. There were, however, some unfortunately introduced characters in the second half, who got close to no screen time, and were not important at all. One of those two characters was likable. Namely, Shinra's father. The cop was just dumb. And Shizuo's little brother was included in the second opening/ending, even though he got no screen time in the latter half of the show. Lord knows what they were thinking then.


OVERALL CHARACTER COMMENTS:


A huge cast of great characters overall, although some people find the random characters from the second half a little too detracting.




ENJOYMENT: Personal Score: 8    General Score: 7.5


I am going to throw this out there right away, but to enjoy this show, you have to "get" it. If you don't, you'll think it's stupid and pretentious. If you do, you'll relish in the character interactions, and the intertwining plot. Just try it out! At least watch the first half, and if you don't really like it, don't watch the rest. I can't really say much in this category, as I want you to form your own opinion about whether or not you think you'll enjoy the show. All I can say, is that I did! The first half of the plot was great, and the characters/character interactions throughout the entire series were great, from my opinion. Everyone was different aspects that they'll like/hate, but with this show, it doesn't hurt to give it a shot. I know some people who really hate it, and found it dumb, but just about everyone loves Shizuo, and Izaya too, although everyone agrees he deserves to die a horrible death. Also, an important note to take is that the ending doesn't offer much closure, and sets itself up for a second season, but nothing has been announced to this date, so be wary.




OVERALL: 8


Suspense, Epic, Tragedy, Comedy, Slice-of-Life, even Romance at some points, this show tries to do it all. With a cast wide enough, it might be worth trying, but while it succeeds at some, it fails at others. This almost seems to be an experiment in storytelling. You go be a judge of that experiment; I would suggest watching this, but not going in with really high expectations, unless all that I have described sounds like your cup of tea.



THANKS FOR READING, HOPE IT HELPED.



                                                                      -Maxtheax


(This was not proof read, as it was too long. It might seem rambily, I am sorry for that.)

Synopsis: Ryuugamine Mikado encounters many interesting people and is soon immersed in the Ikebukuro secret and becomes part of the goings on in Ikebukuro.
Story:(9/10) The story of Durarara!! is quite amazing and is set the city of Ikebukuro following the lives of many characters who are part of different gangs most notably the Dollars. The story follows Mikado and how he starts a new life in Ikebukuro and encounters new and interesting people including the black rider. The story is pretty good especially in the first 12 episodes and the remaining episodes are engaging and pretty good story wise.
Art(9/10) The art is simply amazing inthis anime with all the main cast in colour whereas the background characters are in grey to really push out the main characters and where this may be considered a way to spend less money it works really well and makes the Art of Durarara!! Great. Also the Art is top notch in the actions scenes and the animation is outstanding but there are some parts where the animation is not as good as in other parts.

A quick mention to the openings as well as the animation is done well and like Baccano has the characters name on the screen when you see the characters, also the endings have good animation to.


Sound(10/10) The Sound is one of the high points in this anime with the background music working perfectly with the scenes and all the music interesting and enjoyable. The first opening "Sunset of Betrayal"by Theatre Brook  is brilliant and works well with the visuals of the first opening to. The second opening in my opinion is even better with the song  "Complication" by ROOKiEZ is PUNK'D and work well with the visuals as well. The ending themes are also outstanding with the first ending "Trust Me" by Yuya Matsushita and the second ending "Butterfly" by On/Off great pieces of music and I never wanted to skip either them or the openings. The English Dub for this anime is a dub that I think is quality and voice actors like Johnny Yong-Bosch playing Izaya, Crispin Freeman playing Shizuo and Patrick Seitz playing the brilliant character Simon makes this in my opinion one of the best anime dubs to watch.


Characters:(10/10) The characters are also a high point in this anime but do have some flaws as I think some characters should of had more screen time and be developed more. Some characters like Shinra disappear for a few episodes and his dad Shinren only appearing in minimal episodes which was a bit weird. Also I think Simon should have been involved a bit more in the whole series like he is in the final few episodes. Other than this all the characters are brilliant for Izaya(My favourite character) to Shizuo and Celty and the rest of the cast which are amazing in there own rights. Also the characters are well developed and you start to feel connected to them in some way and by the end you wish there was more.(THERE IS A SEASON 2 COMING IN JANUARY 2015) Also the rivalry between Izaya and Shizuo is a brilliant addition to the anime series as a whole. Overall the characters are outstanding and would be even better if it wasn't for the few problems I had.


Enjoyment:(10/10) A perfect score for enjoyment as I enjoyed the anime immensely and found it outstanding in quality and just a blast to watch:


Overall I think that this anime is amazing and that it is an outstanding view of how anime should be made with brilliant characters, story, art and sound and I only have limited problems with this anime but it still deserves a brilliant rating. Watch this anime if you want I highly recommend this.

This is definitely a show for tastes. It's pretty slow in the beginning, and there are hints of a bigger story, but no set plot. In fact, the plot only really starts to piece together much later in the series. So if you're intrigued enough to be patient and stick around for long enough, you're in for a treat!
The feel of this show is really akin to being in a city. Everything's big, slightly obnoxious, but entertaining. (That's one of this series' strong points - its super colorful and funny characters.) You think you'll probably never see the same people again, but if you stickaround the city for long enough, you see familiar faces and eventually figure out what strings the whole system together. There's also a nice supernatural element to give the whole thing an extra kick.\n\n
Overall, enjoyable - but you might not get hooked right away! (It's also a bit incomplete because the rest of the novel wasn't animated... but season 2 is coming soon!)

Although it seems like the story is quite tranquil and mundane at the beginning, it transcends this level as the story progresses. 
The first ten or twelve episodes create a sort of buildup and introduction to quite funny and unique characters. This buildups includes the infamous headless rider, who is quite well humanized. As these different characters and motivations occur the story starts to build up. 
The pacing of this show is built undo the non-linear style, which is quite unique. This allows some events to be shown out of order and can create confusion. 
The story itself has quite a few fun twists andturns which allow the watcher to enjoy the ride. And that is what it is, a story that moves at a mile a minute and weaves many different plotlines, although this is not perfect. 


Even with the incredible work put into the individual stories, some of the movements are hard to believe. The ending is quite satisfying, but some moments seem unbelievable. There are also some cliche moments. 


Overall though, the story manages to weave a large amounts of plot points almost seamlessly and indulges in cliches, drama, development, and comedy. 


The art is also good, and the background grey characters are well needed. This allows more focus on other characters, and shows their effort to not be the forgettable grey background of an ever changing city. 


It is definitely worth a watch. Just like a rollercoaster ride, durarara has a slow buildup and a thrilling ending that you don't want to end.

This is my first time make a review. Just a short, simple review about Durarara(DRRR).
This is an anime with a wonderful and unique storyline. 
STORY-9/10: The story revolves around people with distinctive background who reside in a city named Ikebukuro. Despite how they go through their daily lives are different, they converge to a point that we do not expect. This element that makes this story is unique. Why I rated 9? It is due to its slow-paced beginning. But I promised you that it is exciting after a several episodes
CHARACTER-10/10: The characters development is beautiful because the development of every character is divided fairly,until that we are kind of confused know who is the main character in this story. They also voiced by talented seiyuu. 


ART-8/10


We must have patience first of all to go through the slow-paced beginning.

First of all, the Anime is based on a light novel with the same name by Narita Ryogo. In the Anime you might see some hints to his other work (Baccano!). For example 2 characters of Baccano! appear in one of the episodes or that the password for the hompage of the Dollars gang is Baccano. There are a lot of other Anime and whatnot shown in the Anime as well. You may think of it as camouflaged advertising but it's done so openly and in a "charming" way that it doesn't hurt the Anime at all.
The story takes place in Ikebukuro which is inTokyo and surrounds the headless horseman who is searching for it's head. So far, so simple. The first episode migtht seem a bit boring but it's simply the calm before the storm and then events happen and it gets messy. It's not a bad thing though. It keeps it interesting and after a while everything comes together and makes sense again. I am not that much into comedy but here it just fits the whole thing so good, it makes the Anime even better. 


As for the characters: each one will blow your mind in one way or another and most of the time you really can't judge a book by it's cover. All of them will go above and beyond your expectations. Lets just take Orihara Izaya as an example. At first glance he is that intelligent bishounen that doesn't seem strong at all but that first impression gets crushed almost instantly and gets exchanged with words like devious, scheming, daggers, fighter, insane and - in my case - fangirl screaming. 

If you're male and think right now that it's just another Anime only meant to entertain crazy Yaoi fangirls: you're wrong. You get to see a lot of nice stuff yourself. Don't miss out on it! ;)


The art is very nice overall but there are some scenes where they just didn't care or made them especially bad on purpose or whatever. I don't care because it's usually not that obvious. Usually....


Don't have much to say about the sound. It's great. The only thing is that i dislike the 2nd opening but it's kinda to be expected after the amazing first one...


As for the enjoyment... Durarara!! only has the tags mystery, supernatural and action, but it contains so much more. You find an innocent love, lots of drama and comedy for example. The first episode might be a bit dull. The rest aren't. As soon as I saw the 2nd episode, I was hooked and just couldn't stop watching anymore. Each week I had to wait for an update was way too long and now, 5 years later, I once again find myself waiting just as impatient for the newest episodes of the latest season. 


In short: Don't miss out on this mindblowing Anime. You'll probably next to never find something as crazy and good as this again!

Okay let's get back in business for another big review. This time it's Durarara!!, Brains Base's latest series. In a nutshell, the series "follows" the life of  Ryuugamine Mikado, a newcomer to the big flashy city of Ikebukuro. Toss in a man as strong as steel, a headless Irish Dullahan and a manipulative sunovabeech and you’ve got a pretty amazing concept.
I said "follows" because unlike many series out there, and much like Narita Ryougo's Baccano!, Durarara!! doesn't really have a set protagonist as such. This is most evident in the first half, where we were presented with VERY Baccano!-styled material, using an often non-linearapproach, and multiple perspectives of a single event. Heck, we even ended up with a very cool cameo by Isaac and Miria, which would have pretty funny for those acquainted with the series.


One of the great things about Durarara!! was its range of characters. Everyone has a favourite. They (most) are interesting to watch and follow, and Durarara!! seldom succumbs to cliche. I think bonus points should go to Ise Mariya who voiced the stalker Harima Mika. She really got Mika’s voice and character down-pat. I don't think I need to talk about the otakus Erika and (especially) Walker. They’re always fun to watch.


However, like another series I JUST reviewed *cough Angel Beats! cough*, character developement also suffers. Earlier in the year I mentioned how this could turn out to be one of the main weaknesses in this series… and it did. Ideally there should have been more time dedicated to developing characters such as Shingen (Shinra’s father) who only appeared twice or thrice, and Officer Kinnosuke (who’s addition barely made a ripple).


A GOLDEN TURD should go to Shizuo’s brother Kasuka, who appeared in the 2nd half OP, yet never actually appeared IN the 2nd half.  Heck, Isaac and Miria appeared more times in this series if you count the billboards and banners that appear in Ikebukuro. Besides that, the three ‘main’ characters in Durarara!! were probably the most boring/less interesting compared to the other ‘major’ characters. I never liked Kida, and I doubt I ever will.


While Durarara!! is of decent length (24 episodes), it just begs for more of what we saw in the first half. There's so many characters in this city, and Brains Base clearly couldn't give all of them their due. Soundtrack is pretty unusual, ranging from some Irish strings to some jazz. However it all fits well on the screen and it just goes to show what weird and wonderful things you’ll find in a big city. As mentioned before, the voice actors are all pretty cool. Kamiya Hiroshi was great as Izaya, and Kana Hanazawa was a cool and calm Anri


There’s not much else I can say about Durarara!!. The animation was great at the start, but started to get a little boring in the definitely more lacklustre 2nd half. The bouts of comedy were actually pretty damn good, and I had plenty of laughs watching the first half. Although it’s nowhere near legendary status, I give Durarara!! a solid thumbs up. Well done Brains Base for another good watch.

Starts off promising, then becomes too weak to enjoy.
Although I'd say I enjoyed it overall the first 12-13 episodes are really the best part of the show and that section ends so nicely with great twists that I'm confused as to why it needed another 12 episodes. While the later episodes aren't a total snooze fest like say SAO, they do revolve around sudden love and really expose how lame the mains are in the same fashion. The writers manage to keep you engaged though, with twisty cliff hangers at the end of each episode for a while but they wind up writing themselves intoa corner when you figure out the final conflict could have been solved in minutes with a simple conversation between the mains. They explain this by having them all be suddenly too timid and afraid to talk to each other and it was a tough sale for me. I could have also done without all the love and relationship drama that mostly makes up the last half. A lot of it didn't make sense and it led to a whimper of an ending.\n\n
In short, if you can deal with a lot relationship drama and questionable character motives, you might find an enjoyable anime overall. However if that sounds like a turn-off, I could still recommend the first 12 or 13 episodes.

Durarara!! is a pleasant show to watch in your spare time if you like being kept in the dark for the majority of the show.
Story:
Durarara!!'s plot is very unique in that it each episode follows around a certain  character, from their point of view. The series goes on like this revolving around 3-4 arcs, just told from various points of view. Don't get me wrong, that doesn't mean there isn't any plot development. In this series all of the characters contribute to essential key points in the movement of the storyline. Most of the episodes only provide snipets into characters' lives, but everything culminatesat the end of the show, and we are given a panoramic view of the story. 


I thought Durarara was a little forced blend of comedy, romance, and the morose, but that doesn't really deter watchers-- it gives the anime a vibe that can only really be described as offbeat and urban.


Art:

I believe the animation for DRRR was very beautifully done. Ikebukuro, the where everything takes place, is illuminated with A+ animation. You'll notice right away that background people or inhabitants of the city may be gray shaded, but you learn to overlook that. 


Sound:

I thought the voice acting was normal, I usually don't really pay attention to the voice actors influxes and dips. The opening and closing themes I thought were forgettable. The background music to the anime however was pleasant.


Characters:

I enjoyed all the characters; they all had their own quirks and backstories and strangely went against what I would expect from their characters. Character development is crazy. This is to be expected from a show with several plot twists. Everyone really has their own story.


Enjoyment:

While this series was interesting, I wouldn't say that I was hooked. Usually being hooked means that I stay up into the wee hours of the morning to keep watching, but honestly I had no problem going to sleep early even after a major plot was revealed. It's interesting though.


Overall:

I would give this series a solid 7. I thought it was good, but not amazing. It's something to watch if you have the spare time, but I wouldn't say it's a must-see.

This was amazing. It doesn't follow a linear storyline where one main character goes through trials and it all falls into place in his or her favor. I find myself rooting for different groups of people who all have their reasons for doing what they do. The soundtrack is excellent too. It really captures the vast urban jungle mood. I barely score 10/10. This made it.

Durarara!!,

In this anime they explain how a certain boy moves into a popular city in Japan, skip more forward into the story- problems start to show up and mysterious events start to occur.. This anime is like an anime called 'Mekakucity Actors' because this anime shows you different perspectives of the characters but Durarara!! is less complex (Idk if its just me but I found Mekakucity Actors really confusing >~) The sound on this anime was probably by far my favorite and by 'sound' I mean the opening and ending, the songs are my favorite because they are so upbeat and fun to dance to.. Yes I danced to it •~• ... I don't really have much else to say but, watch and enjoy! Hope this review was somewha helpful.

9.5/10

I'm big fan of the author so I watched the anime.
